subject: SIMSONN-HB Handbrake in Simsonn Manager
description_text:
Hello,

I’m using a SIMSONN-HB standalone load-cell handbrake with Simsonn Manager
v2.1.2. Windows detects it correctly as SIMSONN-HB, but in Simsonn Manager
I can’t configure it — the Handbrake tab does nothing and I don’t see a way
to select the handbrake as the active device.

Should the SIMSONN-HB appear as a selectable device in Simsonn Manager, and
if so, how is it configured?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,
Tomas Lindstrom

conversations.body_text: Hi Tomas Lindstrom,  At the front bottom of the handbrake (indicated by the arrow), there is a small rectangular hole that contains the recovery button. Please use a toothpick to gently push it to the other side, then reconnect the USB cable. The device will enter recovery mode. Next, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → handbrake-firmware → handbrake-hbpro.sfu in the software, and complete the update. After the upgrade, make sure to switch the recovery button back to its original position. You may also use the VKB tool to check the device connection status. ww

Hello,

Thank you for the clarification. I actually have the SIMSONN SPRO-LC load
cell handbrake. Could you please provide the correct firmware update
instructions for the SPRO-LC model?

Best regards,
Tomas Lindstrom

On Wed, Dec 17, 2025 at 1:58 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Tomas Lindstrom,    Please calibrate the pedals following this procedure: During calibration, pull the handbrake several times using normal force, then save the calibration. Next, click “Write config to device” to write the configuration to the device. After that, test whether the handbrake can reach 100%. If it does, you can proceed directly to calibrate it in the game.

Hi,

I followed the calibration instructions, and while the process seemed to go
okay, the output is now stuck at maximum (100%).

Please see the attached screenshot for reference.

Could you advise on what I should try next to resolve this?

Thank you,
Tomas Lindstrom
